result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa J Lieske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber, all standard release conditions. If imposed. STAYED for probation.
Upon petition, the Court will consider early termination of probation at any point after 6 months, if all condition are met and agent deems appropriate.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Follow through with any recommendation of treatment providers.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Community service to be completed, as a condition of probation, at the direction of the agent.

11:16 AM Defendant Melissa J Lieske in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Court recites offer on the offer.
State files an amended information. 
Court conducts plea colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Amended Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statement to the court.

Court orders the following:
IMPOSED AND STAYED: 

JAIL: 60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/Huber (all standard release conditions).
0  Days Credit.

TERM ON PROBATION:   12 MONTHS; 
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*Follow through with any recommendations of treatment providers;
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done;
*25 Hours of Community Service;

RESTITUTION:  $0;
COSTS:  $243
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
  
Upon Petition - Court will consider early termination of probation at any point after 6 months, if all conditions are met and agent deems appropriate.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:25 AM Defendant Melissa J Lieske in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant to have no contact with Target in the City of New Berlin listed in the Criminal Complaint.

09:00 AM Defendant Melissa J Lieske in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Hughes is appointed.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.
